channel.title: Noclip
channel.description:
This is probably gonna seem like a very nooby question and I'll probably get flamed or something but here it goes.
So I've been fiddling around with the latest client and I made it so that I could use all the :: commands like ::fpson and ::qa_op_test (Not quite sure what that one does lol) I was wondering why noclip doesn't work fully. It lets me click in areas you wouldn't be able to normally (Water, Members areas on a free world) and I start to move in that direction as though I'm about to walk through a fence or wall (Not walking around obstacles as you normally would) but as soon as I reach the fence I just stop. I thought noclip was client side? Is the server stopping me doing this or something?

item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

xxlegitxx, your megalomania is disgusting.

Read full topic

item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

Check out the bcel tutorials in the Java Programming section, glad to see your interested in the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip
item.dc:creator: @Mystery222 Mystery222
item.description:
@Mystery222 wrote:

Death by Ill:

Well noclip is a generally known cheat for PC games that you can walk through walls. IT works in runescape well, and I never heard of it not working fully, so IDK what could have gone wrong.

You might be thinking of it working in Private Servers. I was experimenting in the live servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Mystery222:

Ah OK. Thanks for the clarification. Are there any tutorials anywhere for beginners in client hacking like me? I wanna know what can be done

There are some decent BCEL tutorials in the Java Programming section, that would probably be the place to start.

Read full topic

noclip is client-side, the paths are checked server-side though
